overview:
John is a Co-founder and Software Architect of Prescreen and Zoosk.

During his four-years at Zoosk, John managed broad software projects critical to Zoosk’s user-growth and financial success. Early on, John was responsible for key innovations that bridged a dozen social-networks under a unified user-experience. Later, John evolved Zoosk’s infrastructure further by turning it into a platform-agnostic API, supporting Zoosk’s iPhone, Android, and Zoosk Messenger applications. This investment paid dividends when John hatched Project Cupid, a compiled Javascript front-end that transformed Zoosk’s website into a persistent, real-time social experience that pushes upon the boundaries of the web.

Before starting Zoosk, John worked as a Program Manager for Microsoft’s Developer Division, managing several developer-focused initiatives such as MSDN Answers, Connect beta programs, and a Business Intelligence platform codenamed “Detego”.

John graduated from the University of Texas at Austin with a B.S. in Computer Science.
